metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12391 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Documents formed using data: URLs in an OBJECT element failed to inherit the CSP of the creating context. This allowed the execution of scripts that should have been blocked, albeit with a unique opaque origin. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 76.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12391` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
